content: निष्ठ {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [नि-स्था-क षत्वटुत्वे] (Usually at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>) {@--1@} Being in or on, situated on; तन्निष्ठे फेने. {@--2@} Depending or resting on, referring or relating to; तमोनिष्ठाः <ls>Ms. 12. 95.</ls> {@--3@} Devoted or attached to, practising, intent on; सत्यनिष्ठ. {@--4@} Skilled in. {@--5@} Believing in; धर्मनिष्ठ. --ष्ठा {@--1@} Position, condition, state. {@--2@} Basis, foundation. {@--3@} Fixity, fixedness, steadiness; मनो निष्ठाशून्यं भ्रमति च किमप्यालिखति च <ls>Māl. 1. 31.</ls> {@--4@} Devotion or application, close attachment. {@--5@} Belief, firm adherence, faith; शास्त्रेषु निष्ठा <ls>Māl. 3. 11</ls>; <ls>Bg. 3. 3.</ls> {@--6@} Excellence, skill, proficiency, perfection. {@--7@} Conclusion, end, termination; अत्यारूढिर्भवति महतामप्यपभ्रंशनिष्ठा <ls>Ś. 4.</ls> <ab>v. l.</ab> {@--8@} The catastrophe or end of a drama. {@--9@} Accomplishment, completion (समाप्ति); <ls>Ms. 8. 227.</ls> {@--10@} The culminating point. {@--11@} Death, destruction, disappearance from the world at the fixed time. {@--12@} Fixed or certain knowledge, certainty. {@--13@} Begging. {@--14@} Suffering, trouble, distress, anxiety. {@--15@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) A technical term for the past participial terminations क्त, क्तवतु ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} त and तवत्.) {@--16@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu.
